cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: continuing north-northwest tonight, turning north then north-northeast Friday toward the central Louisiana coast and then inland across central Louisiana and western Mississippi

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of the mouth of the Pearl River to Bay St. Louis, Mississippi
weather_observation.warning_coast: East of Morgan City, Louisiana to the mouth of the Pearl River, including New Orleans, Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast through south-central and southeast Louisiana into coastal Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph sustained, gusts 50–60 mph) likely Friday afternoon through early Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible along the Mississippi River Delta, Lake Pontchartrain, and adjacent lakes
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain with localized totals up to 15 inches could produce flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents along the southeast Louisiana coast
